hints.content:
This circle is split into $4$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{fourths}$, with $2$ pieces shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 4 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/89c792afd82e5a3c85a10b1bda344e6cda656f76)

The circle has **two fourths** of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $2$ pieces shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6d267ed3c0dac3e7d43713e960d81d7eec99ccb)

This circle has **two thirds** of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $2$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{halves}$, with $2$ piece shaded.  

![A circle is divided into 2 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1206db43ce0ff96cbd9968127b0fdd5e7ec1ba7e)

This circle has **two halves** of the shape shaded.

This circle has **two halves** of the shape shaded:

![A circle is divided into 2 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1206db43ce0ff96cbd9968127b0fdd5e7ec1ba7e)

question.content:
**Which circle shows two halves of the shape shaded?**

choices.content: ![A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6d267ed3c0dac3e7d43713e960d81d7eec99ccb)
![A circle is divided into 2 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1206db43ce0ff96cbd9968127b0fdd5e7ec1ba7e)
![A circle is divided into 4 equal parts. 2 parts are shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/89c792afd82e5a3c85a10b1bda344e6cda656f76)
